intro: Cuphea chiribiquetea, commonly known as the Chiribiquete cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Additionally, it plays a role in supporting local pollinators due to its nectar-rich flowers.
